content:
Ladies and gentlemen, the response presented by the affirmative side is truly engaging and thought-provoking. It not only highlights the urgency of saving our planet but also draws attention to the growing trend of bright minds flocking to modern tech companies like Google. 

Furthermore, the fact presented about new Google employees being called 'nooglers' and given a propeller beanie cap on their first Friday is an intriguing piece of information that adds a quirky touch to the conversation. This response has the potential to spark interest and further discussion among the participants and the audience.

On the other hand, the negative side may argue that the response is completely irrelevant to the conversation topic. However, I would like to counter that argument by stating that the engaging level of a response is not solely based on relevance to the conversation. It also depends on its ability to capture the attention of the audience and stimulate their curiosity.

In conclusion, the affirmative side strongly believes that the presented response is engaging and has the potential to enhance the overall quality of the conversation. Thank you.

: While the response presented by the affirmative side may seem engaging at first glance, it ultimately fails to contribute to the ongoing conversation about science and earth. The fact about new Google employees may be interesting, but it is completely unrelated to the previous topic and does not add any value to the conversation.

Furthermore, the response's attempt to draw a connection between saving the planet and the trend of bright minds flocking to tech companies like Google is tenuous at best. It is a weak and unsupported argument that distracts from the main topic and fails to provide any meaningful insights.

In addition, the affirmative side's argument that the engagingness of a response is not solely based on relevance to the conversation is flawed. A response that is completely unrelated to the topic at hand may be interesting, but it ultimately detracts from the overall quality of the conversation and wastes valuable time.

In conclusion, the negative side strongly believes that the presented response is not engaging and fails to contribute to the ongoing conversation. Thank you.

[Rebuttal]: I respectfully disagree with the negative side's argument. The engagingness of a response should not be solely based on relevance to the ongoing conversation. The ability to spark interest and curiosity among the audience is equally important. The fact about new Google employees wearing a propeller beanie cap on their first Friday may not be directly related to the topic of science and earth, but it adds a quirky and interesting touch to the conversation. 

Furthermore, the response's attempt to draw a connection between saving the planet and the trend of bright minds flocking to tech companies is relevant and valid. Modern tech companies like Google have the potential to make significant contributions to the cause of saving the planet through their innovation and resources. Therefore, it is important to discuss this trend and its potential impact on the future.

In conclusion, the affirmative side maintains that the presented response is engaging and thought-provoking. It has the potential to stimulate further discussion and spark interest among the audience. Thank you.

: [Rebuttal]: While the affirmative side may argue that the engagingness of a response should not be solely based on relevance to the conversation, it is important to note that the topic of the conversation sets the framework for what is considered engaging. Furthermore, while it may be true that tech companies like Google have the potential to make significant contributions to the cause of saving the planet, the presented response fails to provide any meaningful insights or connections between the topic and the fact presented.

In conclusion, the negative side maintains that the presented response is not engaging and fails to contribute to the ongoing conversation. Thank you.

Instead, it is meant to draw attention to a growing trend and spark interest among the audience. This can lead to further exploration and discussion in future conversations.

In conclusion, the affirmative side maintains that the presented response is engaging and adds value to the conversation. Thank you.

While relevance is important, the ability to spark interest and curiosity among the audience is equally crucial. Thank you to both sides for your arguments. Based on the arguments presented, I have decided to stop the debate at this point. While the negative side has valid points regarding the relevance of the presented fact, the affirmative side has also made a strong case for the engagingness and potential value of the response. Ultimately, the engagingness of a response can vary depending on personal perspectives and opinions.

Thank you both for your participation in this debate.

Both sides presented compelling arguments regarding the engagingness of the presented response. The affirmative side argued that the ability to spark interest and curiosity is equally important as relevance to the conversation, and that the presented response adds a unique and interesting perspective to the discussion. They also argued that the connection between Google and saving the planet is relevant and valid.

On the other hand, the negative side argued that relevance to the conversation is critical to the engagingness of a response, and that the presented response fails to provide any meaningful insights or connections between the topic and the fact presented. After considering both sides' arguments, I believe that the affirmative side wins the debate. While relevance is important, the ability to spark interest and curiosity should not be dismissed. The presented response adds a quirky and interesting touch to the conversation, and the connection between Google and saving the planet is a relevant and valid topic to discuss.

I would score the engagingness of the response as 2 (somewhat interesting). While the fact presented about new Google employees wearing a propeller beanie cap on their first Friday is quirky and interesting, it is not directly related to the topic of the conversation. Additionally, while the connection between Google and saving the planet is a valid topic to discuss, the presented response does not provide any meaningful insights or connections between the topic and the fact presented.

topic_chat_history:
did you see crazy rich asians ? 
 no i have n't . i heard it was good . 
 i have not yet either but i am aware of it 's cultural impact . it was made from a novel . apparently it is a very good romantic comedy . 
 my mother like it . i think it stars michelle yeoh , henry golding and constance wu , right ? 
 it does . apparently the basic premise is that a woman is engaged to a man and when she goes to meet his family discovers that he is insanely wealthy . his mother rejects her due to her less affluent background . 
 if i remember correctly , jon m chu is the director . 
 yes he is . it was also the first movie to feature an all - asian cast in hollywood in more than 20 years which is quite the accomplishment and i 'm glad that it did well . asians seem very underrepresented in film . 
 the movie is 121 minutes long , which is just right and is pg-13 . 
 that makes it accessible to a bigger audience which is good because then more asian - americans can see themselves represented on screen . 
 well , lets switch topics . are you a science person . , earth is the 3rd planet from the sun . it is also the only astronomical object known to harbor life . 
 i am a little . i enjoy learning about it . i was aware of those facts . i also know that if we viewed the entire earth 's history as a 24 hour period , humans would only represent 1 minute and 17 seconds of that day . that is a mind blowing stat . 
 this is mind blowing . thank god for jupiter . it saves earth from a lot of asteroids heading toward us . 
 that is really surprising since that planet is mostly compromised of gas . we do not even know if there is any solid land there . i wonder how it takes the impact first in this case ? 
 it 's very interesting . so is the fact that the sun is 4x less dense than earth . 
 i know it is much larger but i do n't think it has any solidity to it so that 's interesting . another science fact is that when earth was formed a day was only 5.5 hours long . 
 i did n't know that . i wonder why . there is a place on earth where there is less gravity than the rest of the planet . it is the hudson bay region of canada . 
 i wonder how much affect that has ? is it enough to change weights in any way ? i wonder . i do also know that we are running out of helium and will essentially be out of the gas by the end of the 21st century .
topic_chat_fact: new google employees are called ' nooglers ' and are given a propeller beanie cap to wear on their first friday .
topic_chat_response: wow . we need to get the bright minds of our generation working on saving the planet ! instead , all the smart folks are going to modern tech companies like google . did you know new google employees wear a propeller beanie cap on their first friday ? ca n't get any more quirky than that .
